title: Capability Brown
summary: Lancelot Brown (born c. 1715–16, baptised 30 August 1716 – 6 February 1783),[1] more commonly known as Capability Brown, was an English gardener and landscape architect, who remains the most famous figure in the history of the English landscape garden style, which was to sweep over Europe. He is remembered as "the last of the great English 18th-century artists to be accorded his due" and "England's greatest gardener", although there have always been critics of his style.
